thread.title: Criminal charges against TCU football players dropped
thread.title_full: Criminal charges against TCU football players dropped

title: Criminal charges against TCU football players dropped
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Criminal charges against TCU football players dropped FORT WORTH — Charges against two TCU football players accused of beating up fellow students and stealing their beer earlier this month have been dropped. Post to Facebook Criminal charges against TCU football players dropped FORT WORTH — Charges against two TCU football players accused of beating up fellow students and stealing their beer earlier this month have been dropped.  //on.wfaa.com/1L94Jb9   Criminal charges against TCU football players dropped WFAA Sports and Star-Telegram reports 2:43 p.m. CDT October 2, 2015 Mike Tuaua (93) during a 2014 game against the Samford Bulldogs at Amon G. Carter Stadium. (Photo: Jerome Miron-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
FORT WORTH — Charges against two TCU football players accused of beating up fellow students and stealing their beer earlier this month have been dropped. 
“The victim has refused to pursue criminal charges,” said Fort Worth Police Sgt. Steve Enright. “The case has been closed.” 
Defensive lineman Michael Rea Tuaua and wide receiver Andre Petties-Wilson were involved a scuffle at an off-campus party Sept. 4. They allegedly beat up fellow students and stole a case of Keystone Light beer. 
They were arrested on suspicion of robbery with bodily injury and faced felony charges. 
The two players were reinstated Wednesday after clearing the university’s disciplinary process. Tuaua, 22, and Petties-Wilson, 19, began practicing with the team this week. Arrested football players clear TCU disciplinary process 
"As an ambassador for this university, I'm sad for all parties, not just my guys, that the incident happened," Patterson said after practice Wednesday. "They've had a three-game suspension. I'm saddened that the whole situation went down. Hopefully my guys learn from it." 
Both players were suspended for three games. 
TCU takes on Texas in its homecoming game Saturday. Tuaua and Petties-Wilson are eligible to play.
